title: How to Know if Someone Has Your Number on WhatsApp

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp . Tap the WhatsApp app icon, which resembles a white phone receiver and speech bubble icon on a green background. If you aren't signed into WhatsApp on your current phone, you'll have to follow the on-screen setup instructions before continuing.

steps.title: Tap Chats.
steps.content: Tap Chats . It's a speech bubble-shaped tab at the bottom of the screen. If WhatsApp opens to a conversation, first tap the "Back" arrow in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Broadcast Lists.
steps.content: Tap Broadcast Lists . You'll find this blue link in the upper-left corner of the screen. Doing so opens a list of your current broadcasts. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap New List.
steps.content: Tap New List . It's at the bottom of the screen. A list of contacts will open. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select at least one contact whom you know has your phone number.
steps.content: Select at least one contact whom you know has your phone number. You'll need at least one person whom you know has your number in your broadcast.

steps.title: Select the contact you want to check.
steps.content: Select the contact you want to check. This should be the contact who you want to check to see if they have your number. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Create.
steps.content: Tap Create . It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. This will create your broadcast and open the chat page for it.

steps.title: Send a message to the group.
steps.content: Send a message to the group. Tap the text box at the bottom of the screen, type in a brief message (e.g., test ), and tap the "Send" arrow to the right of the text field. Your message will be sent to the group. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wait a reasonable amount of time.
steps.content: Wait a reasonable amount of time. This will depend on the time of day at which you sent your message, but it's normally best to wait for an hour or two before proceeding, as doing so will give all broadcast list participants who are in your contacts a chance to view the message.

steps.title: Open the info menu for the message that you sent.
steps.content: Open the info menu for the message that you sent. To do so: Open WhatsApp's Chats page, tap Broadcast Lists , and select your broadcast list to open it. Tap and hold the message until a pop-up menu appears. Tap ► on the right side of the pop-up menu. Tap Info

steps.title: Check the "READ BY" heading.
steps.content: Check the "READ BY" heading. Anyone who is able to read your message has your number in their contacts, so you should see the name of the contact whom you know has your phone number here. If you see the name of the person whom you wanted to check here, they have your phone number. Keep in mind that a contact who has your phone number but rarely uses WhatsApp will not show up in the "READ BY" section until the next time they use WhatsApp.

steps.title: Check the "DELIVERED TO" heading.
steps.content: Check the "DELIVERED TO" heading. Anyone who doesn't have your phone number in their contacts won't receive the broadcast message as a chat, so their name will only show up below the "DELIVERED TO" heading. [5] X Research source If you see the name of the contact whom you wanted to check here, they most likely don't have your phone number.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. Tap the WhatsApp app icon, which resembles a white phone receiver and speech bubble icon on a green background. If you aren't signed into WhatsApp on your current phone, you'll have to follow the on-screen setup instructions before continuing.

steps.title: Tap CHATS.
steps.content: Tap CHATS . This tab is at the top of the screen. If WhatsApp opens to a chat, first tap the "Back" button in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This button is in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap New broadcast.
steps.content: Tap New broadcast . It's in the drop-down menu. A list of your contacts will open. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select at least one contact whom you know has your phone number.
steps.content: Select at least one contact whom you know has your phone number. You'll need at least one person whom you know has your number in your broadcast. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Select the contact you want to check.
steps.content: Select the contact you want to check. This should be the contact who you want to check to see if they have your number.

steps.title: Tap ✓.
steps.content: Tap ✓ . It's on a green background in the lower-right corner of the screen. This will create your broadcast group and open its chat page.

steps.title: Send a message to the group.
steps.content: Send a message to the group. Tap the text box at the bottom of the screen, type in a brief message (e.g., test ), and tap the "Send" arrow to the right of the text field. Your message will be sent to the group. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Wait a reasonable amount of time.
steps.content: Wait a reasonable amount of time. This will depend on the time of day at which you sent your message, but it's normally best to wait for an hour or two before proceeding, as doing so will give all broadcast list participants who are in your contacts a chance to view the message.

steps.title: Open the info menu for the message that you sent.
steps.content: Open the info menu for the message that you sent. To do so: Long-press the message until a menu appears at the top of the screen. Tap ⓘ at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Check the "Read" heading.
steps.content: Check the "Read" heading. Anyone who is able to read your message has your number in their contacts, so you should see the name of the contact whom you know has your phone number here. If you see the name of the person whom you wanted to check here, they have your phone number. Keep in mind that a contact who has your phone number but rarely uses WhatsApp will not show up in the "Read" section until the next time they use WhatsApp.

steps.title: Check the "Delivered" heading.
steps.content: Check the "Delivered" heading. Anyone who doesn't have your phone number in their contacts won't receive the broadcast message as a chat, so their name will only show up below the "DELIVERED TO" heading. [9] X Research source If you see the name of the contact whom you wanted to check here, they most likely don't have your phone number.
